main event: An unidentified object was observed moving across the sky near the Big Dipper and North Star on June 26, 1963.
interesting points: The object was first observed as a slow-moving 'star' in the northern sky, then rapidly accelerated and passed overhead.
The object's appearance was similar to the satellite Echo, but its speed was about 8 times faster.
The object made no sound and left no contrails or vapor trails.
A second object, likely the Echo 1 satellite, was observed 10 minutes later moving northwest to southeast.
The weather was clear with no clouds during the observation.
sighted object: a fast-moving, bright, and silent object
